description: Minor material amendment (S.73) to vary condition no.2 (approved plans), seeking to change a 1 Bed (2 Person) consented residential unit to a 3 Bed (6 Person) residential unit at the penthouse level of Block A,  in pursuant to planning permission reference 192597OPDFUL dated 09/12/2020 for'' Construction of an additional 10 storeys on Block A comprising 73 flats (44 x 1 bed and 29 x 2 bed); 4 storeys on Block C comprising 24 flats (24 x 1 bed); provision of a minimum 35% of the total number of additional habitable rooms as affordable housing in Block B, and associated changes to the basement and ground floor levels to provide additional cycle storage and minor changes to the approved landscaping layout (resulting in 97 additional flats overall, bringing the total number on-site up to 701 (comprising 426 x 1 bed, 242 x 2 bed and 33 x 3 bed)''
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents:

1500 PL 001 Site Location Plan, 1500 PL 002 Existing Site Layout Plan - Ground Floor, 1500 PL 020 Existing North Elevation, 1500 PL 021 Existing East Elevation, 1500 PL 022 Existing South Elevation, 1500 PL 023 Existing West Elevation, 1500 PL 097 GA Basement - Lower Level, 1500 PL 098 GA Basement - Upper Level, 1500 PL 099 GA Lower Ground Floor Plan, 1500 PL 100 GA Upper Ground Plan, 1500 PL 155 Rev A Roof Plan, 1500 PL A 100 Rev A Block A Floor Plans, 1500 PL C 100 Block C Floor Plans, 1500 PL A 200 Rev A Block A Elevations - Sheet Â½, 1500 PL A 201 Rev A Block A Elevations - Sheet 2/2, 1500 PL C 200 Block C Elevations, 1500 PL 200 Rev A Composite East Elevation, 1500 PL 201 Rev A Composite North Elevation, 1500 PL 202 Rev A Composite South Elevation, 1500 PL 20 Rev A Composite West Elevation, 1500 PL 300 Rev A Sections A & B, 1500 PL 301 Rev A Sections C & D, 1500 PL A 400 Wheelchair Layout Type A, 1500 PL C 400 Wheelchair Layout Type B, 1500 PL C 401 Wheelchair Layout Type C, 1500 PL C 402 Wheelchair Layout Type D, 1500 PL C 403 Wheelchair Layout Type E, Schedule of Accommodation 1500 PL 802 Rev B-Proposed Affordable housing Breakdown, March 2020 by BUJ Architects, Design & Access Statement Addendum by BUJ Architects;  Environmental Statement Addendum - Volume 1: Non-Technical Summary by Metropolis Green; Environmental Statement Addendum - Volume 2: Main Report by Metropolis Green; Environmental Statement Addendum - Volume 3: Townscape and Visual Impact Assessment by Heritage Architecture; Environmental Statement Addendum - Volume 4: Appendices by Metropolis Green; Daylight & Sunlight Report by GVA; Transport Assessment Addendum by Steer Davies Gleave; Sustainability Statement Addendum by Mendick Waring Rev B.01 dated 03/06/19; Energy Strategy Rev B.03 dated 24/03/20 by Mendick Waring, Aviation Safeguarding Assessment by Eddowes Aviation Safety Ltd; Aviation Review (Heathrow Airport) prepared by Swanson Aviation Consultancy (December 2019), Aviation Review (RAF Northolt) prepared by Swanson Aviation Consultancy (November 2019), Statement of Community Involvement by Kanda Consulting; Planning Statement by Maven Plan Limited, Planning Fire Statement prepared by Fire Risk Solutions, Transport Assessment Addendum prepared by Steer, Energy Strategy Technical Note prepared by Mendick Waring Ltd.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.

| The proposed development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the Construction and Demolition Management Plan (prepared by C J O'Shea & Co Ltd), subject of approved details ref: 181324OPDC2, as discharged 21 May 2018.

Reason: In the interests of minimising the impact of noise, vibration and airborne pollution on the amenities of occupiers of properties within the vicinity of the site, to limit the works to reasonable hours and to minimise the impact of construction traffic on the highway network. In accordance with Policy EU5, T8 of the OPDC Local Plan (2022), Policy D14 of the London Plan (2021).

| The proposed development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the Air Quality and Dust Management Plan (prepared by C J O'Shea & Co Ltd, dated 11th May 2018) and Sensitive Receptors Diagram (dated 5th June 2018), subject of approved details ref: 181325OPDC2 as discharged on 6th June 2018.
Reason: To safeguard the amenities for future occupiers of the development in accordance with policies D5, EU4 of the OPDC Local Plan (2022) and policies  D6 and SI1 of the London Plan (2021).
| The proposed development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the Delivery and Servicing Plan subject of approved details ref: 181688OPDC2 as discharged on 16 October 2018.

Reason: To ensure that the development can be adequately serviced in the interests of pedestrian and highway safety, in accordance with policies D2, D3, T7 of the OPDC Local Plan (2022) and policies D4, D6, D8, SI7, T1, T2, T4, T5, T6 and T6.1 of the London Plan (2021).
| The proposed development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the Site Waste Management Plan, subject of approved details ref: 18327OPDC2 as discharged on 01 August 2018.

Reason: To meet with the requirements of BS5906 and in accordance with , policies D2, D3, EU6, EU7, T7 of the OPDC Local Plan (2022) and policies D4, D6, D8, SI7, T1, T2, T4 and T5 of the London Plan (2021).

| The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the samples of materials and finishes (pursuant to permission 161144FUL condition 10 subclauses A, B C & G) that have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority under decision reference 191292OPDCND and (subclauses D, E, F, H & I) that have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority under decision reference 193387OPDCND as they relate to the proposed development.

Any material proposed and not previously approved pursuant to the above submissions shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to work commencing on the relevant part of the development and the development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved.

Reason: To ensure that all built development would be of a high-quality design standard and in accordance with policy D3 of the OPDC Local Plan (2022) and policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021).

| The works will be carried out in accordance with the insulation and ventilation work details submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority under decision reference 185094OPDCND. The approved insulation shall be implemented before the development is occupied and retained permanently thereafter.

Reason: To safeguard the future occupiers of the development against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policy EU5 of the OPDC Local Plan (2022) and policy D6 and D14 of The London Plan (2021).

| The plant and machinery used will not exceed the existing background sound level during the relevant periods of operation, as per the details submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority under decision reference 190920OPDCND.

Reason: To safeguard future and existing occupiers of the area against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policy EU5 of the OPDC Local Plan (2022) and, policy D6 and D14 of The London Plan (2021).

| The works will be carried out in accordance with the fresh air ventilation system details submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority under decision reference 190920OPDCND. The ventilation system as approved shall be completed prior to occupation of the relevant units and shall be retained permanently thereafter.
Reason: To safeguard the amenity of future occupiers, in accordance with policy EU4 of the OPDC Local Plan (2022) and policies D6 and SI1 of the London Plan (2021).
| The works will be carried out in accordance with the CHP plant details submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority under decision reference 185099OPDCND.

Reason: To monitor the effectiveness of the equipment in order to confirm compliance with energy policies and establish an evidence base on the performance of such equipment in accordance with policy EU9 of the OPDC Local Plan (2022) and policies SI2 and SI3 of the London Plan (2021), and the relevant guidance notes in the GLA Energy Assessment Guidance 2020.

| The proposed development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the Construction and Demolition Management Plan (prepared by C J O'Shea & Co Ltd (Rev 001), dated 23/02/2018) subject of approved details ref: 181329OPDC2 as discharged on 30 April 2018.

Reason: To safeguard adjoining occupiers of the development against unacceptable noise, disturbance and emissions, in accordance with policies EU4, EU5, T7, T8 of the OPDC Local Plan (2022) and policies D6, D11, D14, SI1, S12, T1, T2, T4 and T5 of the London Plan (2021); the Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006); and BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise and TFL Construction Logistics Planning Guidance.

| The proposed development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the Secured by Design Statement (dated June 2018), subject of approved details ref: 183725OPDCDC2 as discharged on 10 December 2018.

Reason: In the interest of the safety of the future occupiers and visitors to the premises, in accordance with policy D1 and D3 of the OPDC Local Plan (2022) and policies D3 and D11 of the London Plan (2021).
| The proposed development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the Travel Plan Rev E (dated October 2022), subject of approved details Ref: 223634OPDCND as discharged on 24 October 2022.

Reason: In the interest of supporting measures that encourage shifts to more sustainable modes of transport, in accordance with policy T9 of the OPDC Local Plan (2022), policies T2 and  T4 of the London Plan (2021).

| No microwave masts, antennae or satellite dishes or any other plant or equipment shall be installed on any of the buildings within the development unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority under this condition prior to installation.
Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the area in accordance with policy D3 of the OPDC Local Plan (2022) and policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021).
| The proposed development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the Site Waste Management Strategy, subject of approved details Ref: 224631OPDCND as discharged on 25 November 2022.

Reason: In the interests of the proper maintenance, safety and security of the site and to ensure that the quality of the public realm and the setting of the buildings are appropriately safeguarded and that that access is maintained for disabled people and people with pushchairs, in accordance with policies in accordance with , policies D2, D3, EU6, EU7, T7 of the OPDC Local Plan (2022) and policies D4, D6, D8, SI7, T1, T2, T4 and T5 of the London Plan (2021).

| Prior to the first occupation of the proposed residential units, the approved dwellings shall incorporate sustainability measures as detailed in the approved Sustainability Statement Addendum (Version (B)01) prepared by Mendrick Waring Limited June 2019.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policy EU9 of the OPDC Local Plan (2022) and policies SI2 and SI3 of the London Plan (2021), and the relevant guidance notes in the GLA Energy Assessment Guidance 2020.

| The Energy Strategy which outlines the measures to be adopted to achieve a reduction of over 35% in carbon emissions will be implemented in accordance with the details submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority under decision reference 193954OPDCND.

Reason:  To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases and to minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policy EU9 of the OPDC Local Plan (2022) and policies SI2 and SI3 of the London Plan (2021), and the relevant guidance notes in the GLA Energy Assessment Guidance 2020
| The proposed CHP Engine shall be installed in accordance with the details submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority under decision reference 194009CND.

Reason:    To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases, in accordance with policy EU9 of the OPDC Local Plan (2022) and policies SI2 and SI3 of the London Plan (2021), and the relevant guidance notes in the GLA Energy Assessment Guidance 2020

| Upon completion of the development and prior to occupation, suitable devices for monitoring the heat and/or electricity imported to the site shall be installed. The monitored data shall be submitted to the local planning authority at daily intervals for a period of three years from final completion. The installation of the monitoring devices should be in a compatible format and the submission of the data shall be carried out in accordance with the Council's approved specifications as indicated in Automated Energy (& CO2) Monitoring Platform [AEMP] document.

Reason:  To monitor the effectiveness of the renewable/low carbon energy equipment in order to confirm compliance with energy policies and establish an evidence base on the performance of such equipment in accordance with policy EU9 of the OPDC Local Plan (2022) and London Plan (2021) policy SI2 ("Be Seen" stage of the energy hierarchy), and Policy 2.5.36 (Best Practice) of the Mayor's Sustainable Design & Construction SPG.
| The works will be carried out in accordance with the drainage strategy submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority under decision reference 181330OPDC2.

Reason: The development may lead to sewerage flooding; to ensure that sufficient capacity is made available to cope with the new development and in order to avoid adverse environmental impact upon the community in accordance with policy EU3 of the OPDC Local Plan (2022) and policies SI12 and SI13 of the London Plan (2021).
| The proposed development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the Radar Mitigation Scheme subject of approved details Ref: 205306OPDCND as discharged on 16 March 2021.

Reason:  To ensure the development does not endanger the safe movement of aircraft or the operation of Heathrow Airport through interference with communication, navigational aids and surveillance equipment in accordance with paragraph 11 of the NPPF (2021).
| Photovoltaic panels shall be provided in accordance with the Technical Note prepared by Mendick Waring Limited dated April 2022 and shall be retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure the provision of on-site renewable energy technologies and to maximise the provision of photovoltaic panels in accordance with policy EU9 of the OPDC Local Plan (2022) and policies SI2 and SI3 of the London Plan (2021), and the relevant guidance notes in the GLA Energy Assessment Guidance 2020.

| The proposed development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the Fire Strategy Statement prepared by Fire Risk Solutions subject of approved details Ref: 205272OPDCND as discharged on 21 June 2022.
The development shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details and retained as such for the lifetime of the development.
REASON: In order to protect the living conditions and safety and security of the occupants in accordance with Policy D12 of the London Plan (2021).
| The proposed development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the Crane Operation Plan, subject of approved details Ref: 210037CND as discharged on 16 March 2021.

Reason:  To ensure the development does not endanger the safe movement of aircraft or the operation of Heathrow Airport through interference with communication, navigational aids and surveillance equipment in accordance with paragraph 11 of the NPPF (2021).

| The proposed development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the Cycle Parking Management Strategy prepared by BUJ Architects, subject of approved details Ref: 205309OPDCND as discharged on 16 March 2021.
Reason: To ensure adequate cycle parking is provided in accordance with policy T3 of the OPDC Local Plan (2022) and policy T5 of the London Plan (2021).

| All of the residential units shall be to M4(2) standards with 10% provided to M4(3) Wheelchair Adaptable or Wheelchair Accessible Standards. Locations and layouts are to be as shown on the drawings listed in condition 2 of this decision.
Reason: To ensure the provision of wheelchair accessible dwellings in accordance with policies D2 and D3 of the OPDC Local Plan (2022) and policies D5, D6, D7 and GG4 of the London Plan (2021).

| No external cladding should be fitted to the building above a height of 120mAOD unless and until the approved Radar Mitigation Scheme has been implemented and the development shall thereafter be operated in accordance with such approved scheme.

Reason:  To ensure the development does not endanger the safe movement of aircraft or the operation of Heathrow Airport through interference with communication, navigational aids and surveillance equipment in accordance with paragraph 11 of the NPPF (2021).
